intro: Sideroxylon ceresolii, commonly known as the Ceresolii ironwood, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to Madagascar. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its dense, dark-colored wood and thick, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry forest and scrubland habitats. Due to its hardiness and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant.
